comments: He is very nice and will help you if you have trouble with a topic. He is comical at times also, so the class is not too dull. I did not have much interest in this class so I did not pay the best attention, but if you like philosophy I would recommend you taking this class. As far as grades, do the assignments and study for all tests.

comments: I really like professor Kims class. His accent was a little heavy and i could not read anything he wrote on the board but when it came time for the test he gave you a review sheet that gives you a lay out for how the test is going to be. He gave us a mid-term, final, and one paper. Would take him again.

tag_professor: Caring (6)  Hilarious (5)  Respected (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Amazing lectures (3)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Inspirational (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: I took this class with prof. Kim in Fall 2013. Now this week, I am graduating. Even though English is not my primary language, but I still did great in his class. If you focus in study, his accent wouldn\'t matter. He is so nice and caring professor. His attitude and caring nature helped me in building my confidence & do well. Highly recommended.

comments: Great professor. He tries his best to make students learn the content. He have a accent which is sometimes difficult to understand but overall a wonderful guy. Attendance is mandatory. He gives homework which he grade. It does not matter if its wrong, he will give the point for trying. Exams are usually based on the what is covered in class.

Everything thats on the test is in his hand outs and he also gives you examples of what the test would be like and the short answers that will be on the test so you can have your information ready the day of the test. The only thing was his accent. its very thick.
